title: GSound-SIR: A Spatial Impulse Response Ray-Tracing and High-order Ambisonic Auralization Python Toolkit
author: Yongyi Zang (Independent Researcher), Qiuqiang Kong (Chinese University of Hong Kong), ...
relevance_why: The toolkit offers direct access to raw ray data and supports high-order Ambisonic synthesis, which can help in generating high-fidelity audio environments and enhance techniques in audio processing and generation.
background: This toolkit simulates how sound travels in three-dimensional spaces and generates spatial audio representations from those simulations.
contribution: GSound-SIR introduces enhanced access to raw ray data and high-order Ambisonic synthesis to solve the limitation of existing acoustic tools, achieving more detailed analysis and higher audio quality in spatial audio applications.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Existing tools output only final audio results without exposing intermediate data, limiting analytic capabilities.
technical_comparison.novelty: This toolkit decouples ray generation from auralization, allowing users to filter and analyze raw data more effectively.

key_innovation: The ability to filter and export raw acoustic rays based on energy thresholds, providing flexibility for in-depth analysis.
real_world_impact: This toolkit could significantly influence research and development in audio technology, enhancing applications in gaming, virtual reality, and architectural acoustics.
limitations: The toolkit only supports stationary sound sources and lacks GPU acceleration, potentially limiting performance in dynamic scenarios.

new_terms.high-order Ambisonics: **High-order Ambisonics (HOA)** is a method of sound reproduction that uses multiple microphone channels to capture and reproduce three-dimensional sound fields with higher spatial resolution.
new_terms.energy-based filtering: **Energy-based filtering** refers to the technique of selecting only those data points (rays) that contribute the most energy to the overall result, optimizing data storage and analysis.

open_sourcing: The library is released under the Apache 2.0 License available at https://github.com/yongyizang/GSound-SIR
